greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Base 4 sum of digits of prime(n).
comment: a(n) is the rank of prime(n) in the base-4 dominance order on the natural numbers.
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Tyler Ball and Daniel Juda, Dominance over N, Rose-Hulman Undergraduate Mathematics Journal, Vol. 13, No. 2, Fall 2013.
example: The sixth prime is 13, 13 in base 4 is (3,1) so a(6)=3+1=4.
results.author: _Tom Edgar_, Mar 24 2014
